wikipedia_page.main: James Marfell Scudamore CB was the Chief Veterinary Officer (CVO) of the United Kingdom and for Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs (DEFRA) from April 1997 until he retired March 2004, and prior to this he was Assistant Chief Veterinary Officer, Scotland from 1990 to 1996. He was made a Companion of the Order of the Bath in the 2004 New Year Honours. He was succeeded as CVO by Debby Reynolds.After he retired from CVO work he became professor of livestock and public health in the department of veterinary medicine at the University of Liverpool.

response: *James Scudamore (courtier) (1568–1619), courtier to Queen Elizabeth I and Custos Rotulorum of Herefordshire, 1616–1619
*James Scudamore (died 1668) (1624–1668), English Member of Parliament for Hereford, 1642–1643, and Herefordshire, 1661–1668
*James Scudamore, 3rd Viscount Scudamore (1684–1716), MP for Herefordshire, 1705–1715, and Hereford, 1715–1716
*James Scudamore (veterinary surgeon), former Chief Veterinary Officer for the United Kingdom
